definition: continuous (esp. of mountain ranges)/to stretch long and unbroken/a continuous link/sostenuto (sustained, in music)

sentences.english: Changde-Jishou expressway goes zigzag in the mountains of Xiangxi.
sentences.chinese: 常吉高速公路在湘西綿延的大山裏穿行。

sentences.english: I shall die again and again to know that life is inexhaustible .
sentences.chinese: 我將一次又一次地死去，以此明白世命是綿延不盡的。

sentences.english: They had scoured the intervening miles of moorland.
sentences.chinese: 他們已經仔細搜遍了其間綿延數英里的高沼地。

sentences.english: But the vast, virgin forest, extending nearly 2,100 kilometers along the eastern seaboard would prove to be a treasure-house.
sentences.chinese: 但是綿延在東部海岸的廣闊原始森林將是巨大的寶庫。

sentences.english: The grassland stretched beyond what the human eye could see.
sentences.chinese: 綿延無盡的草原，一眼望不到邊。

sentences.english: The long line of soldiers and horse and cannon stretched for twenty miles.
sentences.chinese: 大隊人馬和大炮綿延二十多英里。

sentences.english: They run for miles along the length of the tunnels.
sentences.chinese: 它們沿着地道的長度綿延了數英里。

sentences.english: The development of civilization for this blessed land, a great wall and a kingdom of poetry, has become prosperous.
sentences.chinese: 文明的腳步，就在這綿延十里的詩國長城，溫潤開來。

sentences.english: The land covered by golden sand extending several miles is the largest calc-sinter flow in the world.
sentences.chinese: 綿延數裏的金沙鋪地是世界上最大的鈣華灘流。

sentences.english: The research of chime-bells have a long time, far from pre-Qin period.
sentences.chinese: 編鐘研究由來已久，從先秦時期綿延至今。

sentences.english: A vast expanse of mountains, layered over other mountains, and cloud striations.
sentences.chinese: 羣山綿延如浩瀚海洋，層巒疊嶂，雲霧纏繞其間。

sentences.english: Eagle wings Ao sky, snow-capped mountains and days can stretch.
sentences.chinese: 雄鷹振翅翱長空，雪山綿延可及天。

sentences.english: Since Feiyunge hole north, tree-lined lined, stone-level stretching.
sentences.chinese: 自飛雲閣洞北望，林蔭夾道，石級綿延。

sentences.english: Hoist the plant, for long stretches the vines generations.
sentences.chinese: 葫蘆本爲藤本植物，藤蔓綿延則寓意萬代綿長。

sentences.english: For miles and miles there's nothing but desert.
sentences.chinese: 綿延數英里除了沙漠別無他物。

sentences.english: They were packed close together, and their backs were an undulating continuous surface.
sentences.chinese: 它們緊緊地擠在一起，背部構成一片綿延起伏的平面。

definition: continuous/unbroken/uninterrupted/extending forever into the distance (of mountain range, river etc)

lit. warp and weft in weaving; vertically and horizontal/length and breadth/criss-crossed/able to move unhindered/abbr. for 合縱連橫|合纵连横[He2 zong4 Lian2 heng2], School of Diplomacy during the Warring States Period (475-221 BC)
copious/plentiful (of water)/surging (of waves)/refers to home village of first Han emperor 漢高祖|汉高祖[Han4 Gao1 zu3]/fig. majestic
to run through/a connecting thread from beginning to end/to link
to pervade/to fill the air/diffuse/everywhere present/about to inundate (water)/permeated by (smoke)/filled with (dust)/to saturate (the air with fog, smoke etc)
promenade/long hallway/Long Corridor in the Summer Palace, Beijing 北京頤和園|北京颐和园[Bei3 jing1 Yi2 he2 yuan2]
